page.title: 07Birchwood Forest Park
page.content: This park covers 20 hectares.It opened in 1980.The new Ranger Cabin and changing rooms opened in 1983.The park has two permanent Rangers and three temporary ones.In the park there are 6 major play areas,3 football pitches,1 Rugby pitch,2 cricket pitches and a five-a-side football or netball pitch.There's a great BMX track too.All this was made out of the Royal Ordnance Factory.During the war they built 4 bunkers where they made bombs. Now the bunkers are empty but one is going to be a World War 2 Museum.The Rangers organise things in the parks like competitions,bonfires,making things like kites and nesting boxes.They come to school and go out with us to look at trees and birds.In the walled garden they have a special place for blind people to smell the flowers and plants.
